intro: Achyronia psoraleoides, commonly known as the narrowleaf false toadflax, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in dry, rocky soils and open woodlands. The plant features small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are narrow and opposite, often with a slightly hairy texture. It is part of the Orobanchaceae family, known for its parasitic or hemiparasitic species.
